instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 829-3437-b Auto power up
threads.message:
Original issue was liquid damage on the resistors under the CPU <RESISTOR>R1672</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R1449</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R1669</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R1447</RESISTOR>, replaced them and machine boots and works perfectly.
But when shut down the machine will boot up again after 5seconds or so, power button is not stuck because if I hold it down while booted the shutdown window comes up.

Any ideas?

threads.title: 829-3437-b Auto power up
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>PCIE_WAKE</SIGNAL> line. It is probably corrosion somewhere pulling it low or more corroded resistors/traces in the area you fixed. Crap under SMC is also possible.
